body.p: Your body does an adequate job of protecting you against harmful pathogens in general, however there is also a a component to your immune system that mounts a specific response to a particular antigen. Your innate immune system __________________ while the adaptive is ________________________. Which answer correctly fills in the blanks?

multiple_choice.choice: contains responses you are born with, activated only through vaccinations
responds quickly because the components are already working, slower because it requires a specific clone of cells to divide and expand
helps to activate the inflammatory response, only involved with killing pathogens
is the main response target by vaccinations, not very important

feedback.p: Incorrect. The adaptive immune response starts to work once the immune cells are fully functional.
Correct. The clonal expansion of the adaptive immune response can take days.
Incorrect. The adaptive immune response can also stimulate the inflammatory response.
Incorrect. The adaptive immune response is the target for vaccinations.

body.p: Each naive T and B cell reacts to one epitope on the antigen in a certain three dimensional arrangement. Why is there sometimes cross reactivity?

multiple_choice.choice: Related molecules have very similar structures and could have the same or very similar epitopes.
Clonal expansion results in a loss of specificity.
Adaptive immunity developed during childhood has errors.

feedback.p: Corrrect. Molecules made by related organisms may be evolutionarily conserved and have identical or almost identical structures.
Incorrect. Clonal expansion is usually very precise.
Incorrect. Adaptive immunity acquired during childhood may lose its potency over time, which is why you need booster shots..
Incorrect. An allergic response can be a form of adaptive immunity if IgE antibodies are secreted.

body.p: What are two main differences between the innate and adaptive immune response?

multiple_choice.choice: The cells involved and location of responses.
Time of the immune response due to the immunologic specificity and immunologic memory.
Adaptive responses occur in the lymph node while innate responses occur in the blood.
Inflammatory response and lysis of pathogens by phagocytic cells.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Although different cells are categorized into innate and adaptive immunity, both innate and adaptive cells respond to pathogens in the same locations of the body.
Correct. These are the two main differences between the innate and adaptive immune responses.
Incorrect. Adaptive and innate responses both occur in the lymph nodes, and the blood transports both adaptive and innate cells to tissues where they will respond to pathogens.
Incorrect. Both of these immune responses are categorized as innate responses.

body.p: Memory cells are an essential part of the adaptive immune response. What cell type can become a memory cell?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Phagocytic cells are categorized as cells of innate immunity because they lack memory.
Correct. The immune system has both T helper Cells and B cells which can respond to an antigen the body has seen before.
Incorrect. T cells are part of adaptive immunity and develop memory cells; however, another answer is more complete and therefore more correct.
Incorrect. These cells carry oxygen in the blood but are not part of immunity.
